title: G4MF Shape
description: A shape in G4MF is a pure geometric object defined by an enumerated type and a set of size parameters. Shapes are useful for things like physics calculations, but are not expected to be directly used for rendering.

curves.description: An array of curves of the shape, if any.

heights.description: The index of the accessor storing the heightmap data, if any.

length.description: The length of the ray shape in meters, if the shape is a ray.

mesh.description: The index of the mesh to use for a mesh-based shape.

size.description: The base size of the shape in meters.

type.description: The type of the shape. The default value is `general`, meaning the shape is a general shape with a size and optional curves, which can be used for boxes, spheres, capsules, cylinders, etc.

anyOf.description: A general shape with a size and optional curves. It can be used for boxes, spheres, capsules, cylinders, etc. The center of the shape is at the origin of the local coordinate system.
A concave mesh shape, defined by a mesh. The mesh exists relative to the local coordinate system.
A convex hull mesh shape, defined by a mesh. The mesh exists relative to the local coordinate system.
A heightmap shape, defined by an array of height values, with the size property defining the dimensions of the data in the heights accessor.
A plane shape, defining an infinite boundary. The plane points up in the local +Y direction from the local origin.
A ray shape, defining a one-way line segment. The ray points in the local -Y direction from the local origin.
